intro: Hieracium vulgatum subsp. charlottenburgense, commonly known as the Charlottenburg hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow daisy-like flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. It has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces seeds in a composite flower head. This subspecies is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and subtle morphological differences from other Hieracium species.
